website_summaries.verdict: Intended for preschoolers, this bike includes a footrest so that kids can easily find their center of gravity.
pros: Patented footrest design helps to find center of gravity
Seat height ranges from 13.5 to 16.5 inches
Accommodates children up to five years old
cons: Handlebars are a little tight and take extra time for assembly

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality balance bike
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike. It's well-built and easy to adjust. My only complaint is the description. My son is almost 3 years old and he's nearly outgrown the bike, even with the seat and handlebars up all the way. He's in the 70th percentile for height, so he's tall, but certainly not as tall as a 5 year old, and the bike's description says that it's suitable for kids up to 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good quality balance bike, our 3 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for our son's 3rd birthday 6 months ago. It didn't take him long to figure out how to ride it and within hours he was flying down our driveway (it has a slight decline) and along the sidewalk. Our son rarely uses the footrest, he usually just spreads his legs apart. This bike was much more affordable than other balance bike, so we were a little apprehensive about its quality. But as soon as we received it we were relieved that it exceeded our expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Gerlinde G

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional value for half the cost of other brands. 3 days on her balance bike and my 4yr old was pedaling with the big kids. No training wheels! Highly recommended. Word of caution, there are no brakes so teach your child how to run off into the grass. We've ruined shoes dragging toes because she gets going "zooming fast" with her feet up. The foot board is excellent. Highly adjustable. All the way up for my tall girl. Lil sis will have it all the way down next year ;)
customer_reviews.author: kbt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value and it works! my son, 4 years old, rode this for less than 10 times, now moved on to a real bike! The KaZAM is so well built, it's still shiny and pretty, that we can save for his lil' cousin who's not yet 2. It's also light and can assemble/dissemble easily. I took the parts apart then put the whole balance bike inside a check-in luggage, still got room for other items. It travels well! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Orig Yip

customer_reviews.title: Heavier and larger than Strider balance bike. Not good for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Was too heavy and seat was too high for my 2 1/2 year old son to use. We ended up returning this bike and bought a Strider balance bike at a local bike shop. The Strider is much lighter and the seat is lower to the ground. My son's been using it for 3 months now and is a pro! If you're looking for a balance bike for a toddler, go with the Strider. If you're looking for one for a child that's a bit older, the KaZAM might work... it just didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: SkiScorcher88

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for balancing
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for balancing; foot rest is probably the best part, it really helps them learn to glide and balance. My daughter could pedal but struggled with balance. She rode this for about 2 weeks, took to it right away and then was off on a regular bike without training wheels. (Age 4)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He is now 2yrs 4months and is able to run pretty fast with it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2 year old in May 2018. (2yrs 2months at the time to be exact) He loves it. He is now 2yrs 4months and is able to run pretty fast with it. He has not balanced on it yet but he's getting really good with steering. I did see some negative reviews about the tires...they are not air as some mentioned. They seem to be a very thick foam of some sort however, that is fine with me. I know I haven't had the bike long yet, but they seem to be keeping up really well. We go outside on the sidewalk to ride on average 4 days a week for about 15 - 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MVP 2016

customer_reviews.title: Best bike on the market for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about this bike. My 4 year old son went from hardly riding a bike hardly at all to being confident enough to glide down huge hills going very fast haha he learned this in mere weeks from getting this bike! It came naturally. I’m so grateful that we found this bike instead of battling training wheels. With his strong sense of balance now, I have no doubt he will be ready for a big boy bike with pedals soon!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit!
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for a more inexpensive balance bike. This has been great we're coming up in a year of use and not only was assembly easy but I love that the seat is so easy to adjust. The wheels are more plasticky rubber but have been fine. And the bike has been perfect for my three year old and her older sister loves it as well she is a small 5 year old. Very pleased. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: David and Kay-Marie Stanger

customer_reviews.title: This bike taught my kids how to ride their bikes
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike. I will be honest and say I wasn't sure how to teach my boys how to ride their bikes without training wheels. TV made it look easy but it only led to my boys and myself being frustrated. I decided to try a balance bike even though I was skeptical. This has been one of the best purchases ever. My boys started riding their bikes last summer all by themselves without any frustration or tears because of this balance bike! I would buy this 100x over again.
customer_reviews.author: CKEMBLLR

customer_reviews.title: The best starter bike ever
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, one for a 5 year old and one for our 3 year old. He started riding his when he was two and now he cruises on that thing and I get comments everywheee we go of cool and different his bike is and how fast he can go in it. He glides and puts his feet up and goes faster than his 4 year old friends on their peddle bikes. Best bike ever
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend, but have tools on hand
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and quality materials. The instructions were not completely accurate (but it's pretty intuitive to put it all together) for the model we received and a wrench was not included. A random screwdriver was at the bottom of our box, but it didn't seem to be intentionally part of the packaging. Plastic parts (3 black circles, one white circle and a rectangular piece for the front frame ends) are included that keep the nuts and bolts from being damaged or jostled during transport. Bike seat slides down a bit, but stronger tightening may solve it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Bike!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE this bike! We had a cheaper version of one that broke and couldn’t live without the glider bike, so I bought this one. Easy to put together, easy adjustments, lightweight and the glider step is perfect! Couldn’t be happier with it! The only thing I’d like to see in the future is for the handle bars to easy adjust like the seat does. Other than that, 100%! Update: This bike is amazing! My husband accidentally ran it over with his truck backing up and it held up. Nothing broke, not even the seat. Except a few scratches, it’s still as good as new!
customer_reviews.author: cody gibson

customer_reviews.title: he feels like a big boy
customer_reviews.text: My 2yr old son loves this bike. he feels like a big boy, while being able to learn how to balance on his own. The concept of this bike is great. and just seeing the difference in him riding it from day 1 to a couple months later is huge. I thought this was a big mistake the first time we took it out, but more and more he was more comfortable, and he was picking up his fit to glide down hill before you knew it! Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Katie B

customer_reviews.title: Tires are foam
customer_reviews.text: We have a classic Kazam balance bike, and the bearings went out in the front wheel. I looked up the parts, and the parts to fix it were going to be more than just buying another bike! I was slightly disappointed when this one arrived due to the foam wheels. They slip more and make the ride rougher for our toddler. Other than that, we are happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Training Bike
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old just learned to ride a pedal bike in 5 minutes due to him using his KaZAM for 6 months as a ‘first bike’. We never had to use training wheels. I can not recommend this enough as a proper bicycle trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance bike! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old grandson absolutely loves his KaZAAM bike! Assembly is pretty straight forward. My son-in-law had no trouble at all with assembly, and that's not really his thing. My grandson has developed his balance quite rapidly, and doesn't even realize it happened; he's just having a ball! A neighbor girl has a scooter, and they zip around together, racing and doing tricks. Highly recommend this bike. I'm buying them for all of my grandkids!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bummed to find that the wheels are plastic, not rubber. But, my son adores this bike and despite the plastic wheels, he rides it through the forest, through puddles, up and down hills, on gravel, in mud, and on pavement and it's holding up great! He had one of those fancy wood balance bikes and refused to sit on it- this one was just what he needed to build his confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: It was so easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: So far we are loving this balance bike! My new two year old is 37" and fits perfectly. It was so easy to put together. The pieces come almost fully assembled, there's really no way you can mess it up. The tires are sturdy and the handle bars seem really wide but once the kids get on it they are just right. My 5 year old is loving it as well. The seat and handlebars are so easy to adjust even on the fly. We just keep the Allen wrench in the car and can easily make it usable for both children in the same outing
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Byers

customer_reviews.title: Being low to the ground and with no pedals to get tangled up in he catches himself easy if he falls
customer_reviews.text: We got this bike for our son's 3rd birthday and it has been a huge hit. He was almost instantly able to figure it out without coaching from us, and he loves it. Being low to the ground and with no pedals to get tangled up in he catches himself easy if he falls, has figured out coasting and turning, and we can see his balance improve every time he rides it. The wheels are solid foam which makes it great on our country roads with stickers. This is definitely the way to go when it comes to moving kids to a two wheel bike!
customer_reviews.author: Marquette Mower

customer_reviews.title: This is a great idea for little kids who are ready to learn ...
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the quality of this little bike. We got it for my son's 4th birthday and worried he'd be too big for it. However, the foot plate on the bike allowed him to do some neat tricks with it once he mastered the balance (which took him no time at all). This is a great idea for little kids who are ready to learn to ride a bike and turned out to be much more fun for him than I anticipated. This brand also seems like they are producing a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually an easy, and fun way to learn balance!
customer_reviews.text: My child loves using it! Once we let him try to ride a pedal bike without training wheels, he immediately could ride perfectly. Amazing! We also have a one year old coming up who will be using this. I'm confident that she will also be riding a regular bicycle at a very young age. Also, this is a much SAFER way to learn balance, instead of just pushing the children on a regular bicycle. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance bike for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 year old. After a few days he was cruising around with his feet up balancing. I was a bit weary of the foam tires since I thought they would be more slippery but they seem to be ok. My son loves it so I am happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Troia

customer_reviews.title: Better than training wheels
customer_reviews.text: After she struggled for months with training wheels on a regular bike, we bought our daughter this one. Even though she was a bit too big for it (a tall 5yo, I wish the seat post was longer) she jumped right on. After literally only 4 or 5 sessions on the balance bike, she was back on her regular bike with no training wheels. So you wont use it for long, but you will be glad you bought it.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Great design.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bike for 3 year old, my son loves it. I like this style balance bike more than others due to the foot rest in the middle of the bike, he can put both feet on the door rest while he glides down a small hill.
customer_reviews.author: Kren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Balance Bike
customer_reviews.text: Great packaging and super easy to put together. Quick adjust seat is perfect for multiple children. My 5 year old took this within minutes and was balancing like a pro. I think this is going to really help him when it comes time to learn to ride without training wheels. I'm sure it will get passed down to my other children as well as it is very durable. Even the tires are plastic and not inflatable making it even easier to maintain. The platform to put your feet on is a great idea. I wouldn't get a bike without that as it builds confidence taking your feet away from the road. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: MR ROBERT J K BARTLETT

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing, teaches kids balance
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing, teaches kids balance, control and confidence, this bike is not big in South Carolina, I would have not known about the bike if my sister in law had not told me about it, my grandson would refuse to even try and ride his bike without the training wheels, so I bought the stryder bike, he learned to control everything in a short period of time, we are very pleased
customer_reviews.author: TwylaHarrelson

customer_reviews.title: Wear helmet and tennies.
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old grandson loves this "bike". Great for balancing. Make sure shoes are on as he did fall being barefoot and skinned the top of his foot. Would not get on it again for a couple of weeks. Got back on about a month ago and has ridden it every day since. Also needs helmet.
customer_reviews.author: J from South Texas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all around
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is just starting, but the bike is wonderful. The seat came with a tiny rip. I admit it was real tiny, but I know my 1 year old especially will pick at it until it's huge. So I sent a picture to customer service to see if they'd send a replacement. Like easiest people to deal with, they didn't even give me a hard time about how small the whole was. Also it was shipped EXTREMELY quick. I mean like got to my door in a couple of days and this was right before Christmas too! Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this bike my son was 2 1/2 when he got it and within 2 weeks he had great balance. Now 4 months later he is a Daredevil on it! And the foot board is so great, he can get going and put his feet up and really get the balance of a normal bike, which I don't foresee any issue when it is time to move up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves this bike. She immediately was going pretty fast on it, but hasn't figured out how to lift her feet yet. She is 37 inches with somewhat short legs, and the lowest height was perfect for her. I don't know if she would have fit on it if we had bought it much earlier. Oh, and we bought the blue because it was the cheapest, and it is a beautiful color! Very true to the picture. Not your standard primary blue.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, caution on tires
customer_reviews.text: Great little bike, however the tires are just plastic and if they get much use.. wear down pretty quickly. I love the fact that there is a spot for the kiddos to place their feet. Bright fun colors too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic design, my unstable and accident-prone 4 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic design, my unstable and accident-prone 4 year old got the hang of this after only a few tries, and she really does use that little in-step to rest her feet while coasting. I feel confident when we move her to a bike with pedals she will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: nnchanlady

customer_reviews.title: I personally like the foam tire because theyre durable and u don't ...
customer_reviews.text: My son looves his new bike. For me, it was VERY ez to put together as it came mistly that way. I personally like the foam tire because theyre durable and u don't have to pump air into them. That is a convenient feature that ANYONE can apprecuate. ONE less thing to concern ourselves with. I figure if they ever become an issue he will be will grown out of the bike by then. my 3 year old was balancing on the bike one week after he had gotten. and he has not gone one day without getting on the bike and riding is freely. bottom line I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly really skeptical about buying one of the cheaper balance bike brands. We got this for my 3yr old’s birthday. The frame is really sturdy. The wheels were not what I was expecting. They are almost like a really firm foam material. I was still skeptical. We’ve had it 3 months now, and the wheels have held up great. I can now say I’m very glad that I went with one of the less expensive brands.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike and so does our 2 year old. I looked at all the balance bikes and this was the most decorated one. I will purchase again in the future. Great quality for the price. You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves this
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves riding this bike. At the park he let some friends try it and they loved it too and were asking their moms for 1. He was asked what is his favorite thing to do outside and he proudly said, riding my balance bike. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Wdrop

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old is loving it!
customer_reviews.text: What a great concept! My three year old loves his new "dirt" bike. He traded his Paci with the mail lady for this little jewel and it was the best purchase decision I've made for him YET! Day 3 and he is starting to balance after really getting the hang of steering first. I love this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffiney Addis

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This bike was much smaller than other Kazam bikes I have purchased in the past. It was cheaply made, all plastic. I do not recommend buying this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it and gets better on it each time she rides it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it and gets better on it each time she rides it. Way cheaper than the name brand one. I just wish the wheels were rubber instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Great strider bike for 3 to 6 year olds!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves this bike. I wish we'd bought this type of bike for our 5 year old daughter who has ended up using her brother's strider more than her own with training wheels. I don't like the plastic tires, though, and haven't paid the extra for the rubber ones.
customer_reviews.author: Helen F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sturdy Bike - Very easy assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Purchased for 4 1/2 yr old granddaughter who is not so fond of pedals. I called it a "scooter bike" in order to get her to try it. She loves it! I anticipate that she will master the balancing within the first week. The bike arrived quickly & well packaged. It was VERY EASY TO ASSEMBLE. I'm a grandma and I was able to assemble the bike by myself in under 10 min. Everything required for assembly is included in the box.
customer_reviews.author: TED

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it! Durable and fun for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using his bike for over a year, and he LOVES it! He’s only 3 but he’s a pro on this scoot bike. The paint finish is still bright and the bike looks great. I like that it’s light weight and easy to carry. The tires are a sturdy solid foam that have held up well so far. I have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Stef9151

customer_reviews.title: Really not stupid!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the stupidest idea ever! Bike with no pedals. Then I read how much it eases the transition to a bike. We have not done that yet but my son loves the balance bike and he is fast on it so we can take a brisk evening walk and he can keep up. He also brings it out whenever older kids are on their bikes a neighborhood playground. It is sturdy and easy to put together. It is a winner already and if it makes transition to a real bike easier, it is just icing on the cake
customer_reviews.author: CLW

customer_reviews.title: Happy Granddaughter on Kazam
customer_reviews.text: Great starter bike. My granddaughter loves it. Starting out if she went all the way down the driveway without putting her feet down we would say Kazam and she loved it. It didn't take long and she was putting her feet up on the rest and balancing.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Sharon L. Colligan

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bike! We bought it for her over a year ago and have since bought her a pedal bike, but she always goes back to this one. It's very low to the ground and so she feels very comfortable on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my three year old son! Could use better materials, especially on the "quick release" areas, as they force you to make them not so quick release in order to stay tight and safe... But great overall! My son loves it and I think this is definitely one of the better strider your type toddler bike designs with the foot rest and low frame.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: great for preschoolers
customer_reviews.text: The kids absolutely love the bikes. The first few days they kept falling over, but 85% of them can now ride it successfully without falling. Some of the older kids do tricks on them too...a Definite by again. I love the little stepping area in the middle of the bike as well.
customer_reviews.author: Konane Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Safe and a Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: My 2, now 3 year old loves it. He will probably get a few more years out of it to boot. He gets around on this bike like nobody's business and will never need training wheels. Initially there is a bit of getting used to as a child has to discover how to ride it rather than walk it. After that, the open road awaits. Awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Son's Christmas. He was 3. Almost a year later he is zooming all over the place. took about a good week for him to feel real comfortable. we started out in the house, so he was not afraid of the concrete. He would toddle around the kitchen or living room. even just to sit still on it and watch TV. The 2 wheels takes some getting use d to. once he got the feel for it in our home, we took him outside. He did very well from there.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudsurfing

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together. Love the color. Great balancing bike. And the price it’s even better. I saw others for twice the price and I didn’t see much difference.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy steel frame with foam & plastic tires so no having to air it up
customer_reviews.text: Cute little sturdy bike for my 3 yo. It looks small when your putting it together but when my son is on it it’s actually a little big and heavy for him. He’ll be able to get good practice in as he learns and grows. It’s all metal except for the tires and plastic “rims.” It’s a great little balance bike for him to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: ANewell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: These were gifts for our 2 and 3 year olds. They take some getting used to, but once they get the hang of it, it is a lot of fun! They are just getting to the right size at 2/3 years old, but have plenty of room to grow into them more. I think they would work well until 4/5, but then they would be too small. It is very high quality product, and very easy to assemble. The directions are easy to follow and the steps are very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal M.

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great. Next time I will pay more for the Alloy version.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble, and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about these bikes- I bought two for my twin boys, the figured out how to ride them immediately. They were also extremely easy to assemble! I love the little foot stand for when they get good enough at riding to put their feet up when they gain enough balance. They are great for on or off road either one.
customer_reviews.author: Abimarie

customer_reviews.title: No Kick Stand FYI
customer_reviews.text: Works great but I knocked off a star because not having a kick stand is more annoying then I’d expected. But I knew this fact when I bought. Other then that, works great
customer_reviews.author: Summer Shannon

customer_reviews.title: but he is definitely getting the hang of it better than we expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this our very active boy on his 2nd birthday, and he LOVES it! We had to lower the seat all the way down, but when lowered all the way down, he can put his feet flat on the floor. So far we have just used it inside because he doesn't go very fast, but he is definitely getting the hang of it better than we expected! The wheels are sturdy and the blue color is so fun! I can't wait to see him progress, I have a feeling he will be balancing on it by next year! :)
customer_reviews.author: Molly T.

customer_reviews.title: Cute bike. Cant ride without help.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 (almost 3) year old daughter for Christmas. It is very cute but she doesn't really enjoy it on her own. We have to push her. Lol. I wish i would have purchased a traditional bike with training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our daughter's 3 year old birthday, she didnt seemed super impressed at first glance. It did not take long for her to warm up and really love it. video 1 is maybe 2 days after the purchase video 2 about 2 weeks after receiving it. It's lightweight, easy to carry perfect height and easily adjustable. The box came with all the tools needed to put it together, just make sure you tighten everything up. SHE LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for my 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for my 3 year old. She wanted a bike that looked like her big sisters and this was the perfect fit. Easy for her to get around, light weight for her to hold up and steer and will grow with her. Like that there is a place for her to put her feet once she gets the balance part down.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful in bicycle skill building
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter for Christmas. My son's been riding his bike w training wheels since last Christmas and very reluctant to ride without. He grabbed this bike as much as he could from his sister starting Christmas Day. He immediately picked up the balance skills and was riding his bike without training wheels on New Year's Day. My daughter loves it and is already getting the hang of balancing and coasting.
customer_reviews.author: DIY DadTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Not as we expected
customer_reviews.text: It's heavier than expected, the tires don't grip very well and the seat seems narrow and uncomfortable even for my toddler.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: All of the kiddos in my neighborhood love it as well
customer_reviews.text: We've had this bike for some time now. My 3 year old struggled at first but quickly got the hang of it. All of the kiddos in my neighborhood love it as well. They fight to ride her different bike. She's nearly 4 and I feel she's got her balance down and is ready to get pedals.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Leigh’s weight small/son loves
customer_reviews.text: Thought the tires were going to be more like rubber. They are more like true plastic. Other than that nice bike. Does what it is supposed to do. Inexpensive but great material will stand up to anything. Lightweight bike. My 3 year old can carry it. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: KaiT CTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: A bit large for my nephew but otherwise great bike.
customer_reviews.text: Read that this was for 24+ months but the box says 3+yrs. A bit large for my nephew but otherwise great bike.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Valenti

customer_reviews.title: Everyone loves this. I do, my son does ...
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loves this. I do, my son does, and most importantly my 4 year old daughter for whom it was intended really took to it and now zips around. I'm sure when she's 5, she'll be more than ready for a "big" bike!
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Easy to assemble. Just put on the front wheel, seat, and handlebars. Looks great. Seems to be high quality. My son is learning quickly on this bike. As soon as he moves up to a regular bike I plan to let my 3 year old daughter start learning on this bike
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: was delivered quickly, very easy to put together, it literally took less time to put the bike together than to remove it from the box, my daughter has been riding it for approx. 4 hours and I already have noticed a big difference in her balance! I would recommend it to anyone looking to get their child started on riding without training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: great learning balancing bike
customer_reviews.text: great learning balancing bike, my 2 year old is getting used to it and gaining the confidence. the plastic "deck" i feel is unnecessary right now, unless he starts to glide and put his feet up which he may. I originally purchased a strider, but felt for $100 there was no significant difference
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love how adjustable it is and that the tires are ...
customer_reviews.text: My three year-old learned to balance on this in just a month or two. I love how adjustable it is and that the tires are low (or no) maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Reed

customer_reviews.title: It took a month or two for my 3 year ...
customer_reviews.text: It took a month or two for my 3 year old to figure out how to balance and coast on this bike, but he loves it now and it makes our walks so much faster and more enjoyable! We think he'll be ready for a "real" bike this coming year.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sons 3rd Birthday. It is way way too small. He might have fit at 18 months whenever he was using a step one motorcycle. The seat does not go up more than an inch before you reach the “minimum insert” line.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this bike. My daughter has been riding it for about 6 months and still loves it. We use it almost daily. Her balance has increased and her confidence has grown. I don't think she will need training wheels when we switch to a peddle bike. She can fly on this one. It is comfortable for her (3.5 yrs) and has easily grown with her.
customer_reviews.author: Blair S.

customer_reviews.title: Such a wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Bought to help my granddaughter learn to ride a bike. She was balancing within two days of using this and then starting working to ride a regular bike. She always wanted to come back to this bike. Such a wonderful idea
customer_reviews.author: Beth Hamburger

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice
customer_reviews.text: Took about 30 to35 minutes to put together. Seems sturdy. Will up date review more after kid rides it more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter's third birthday. It's the perfect size. Well made. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the clamp that holds the seat in place has had to be tightened a few times.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks our 3 and 4 Year old are on their way to balancing! They ride them daily
customer_reviews.author: JULIE HEUER

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool for 5 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our 4yo daughter, 5 in June. She is tall for her age and the bike works great. Had it a month now and she is zooming along now.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Barely big enough for my 4yr old 46" tall daughter.
customer_reviews.text: Wish the tires were a bit more durable and had more grip.
customer_reviews.author: CryptoChaos

customer_reviews.title: No-grip plastic tires, kind of like a big-wheel
customer_reviews.text: We had a Kazam before and assumed we were buying the same one. I guess we didn’t realize they had a low-quality version with the no-grip, non-inflatable wheels. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ptwice

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Did not care for this product, sent it back. The middle was too long and my daughter could not navigate it at all. She has a shcwinn balance bike she loves and does tricks on. I was hoping for another similar product and this was just not it.
customer_reviews.author: Dara Rexroad

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The bike came without the quick seat fastener attached. There are pieces missing to attach the seat so I can't fully assemble it. Please contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She now rides a big bike beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old struggles to lean to ride a bike, but with the balance learning techniques of this bike. She now rides a big bike beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Dollie

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, my three year old loves it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, my three year old loves it and rides it all the time. It took him a week or so to get the feel for it but now its great. I think this will really help him to learn how to ride. The only downside is that the clamp that secures the steering wheel did not tighten enough to keep it tight. I fixed it by wrapping packing tape around the stem.
customer_reviews.author: MikeC

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works as it should
customer_reviews.text: It’s a kids balance bike! It can’t be comfortable and shouldn’t be light
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hull

customer_reviews.title: Nephew's favorite gift!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 2 1/2 year old nephew for Christmas 2016. Absolutely his favorite gift! Could walk with it on day one and was taking big strides in the first month with both feet up. Incredible advances!!! He loves the foot rest on the bottom. Highly recommend this bike!
customer_reviews.author: R Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Lovin’ this bike!
customer_reviews.text: My Three-year-old is in love with this bike. It only took him one day to ride it well. All the neighbor kids wish they had one.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: My 2.5 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, super convenient for a beginner to ride. My 2.5 year old fit on it at it's lowest setting just perfectly. I think he's average height for his age.
customer_reviews.author: Kemarie Whiting

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter love it and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: The Emerson's

customer_reviews.title: Gift for grandchild=happy with it. Not a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grandchild=happy with it. Not a lot of assembly. The only assembly challenge was where the handlebars fit into the collar was too tight a fit, but managed anyway,
customer_reviews.author: Alice Susan

customer_reviews.title: Success on first try!
customer_reviews.text: Our shy little grand daughter was cruising around on her new glider bike on the first try. Peppa the Pig was a bonus - she loved it. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Fayette Terlouw

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Very cheap bike I was very disappointed. Not worth 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: smilieseveryday

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike! Love to foot rest option that most balance bikes don’t have
customer_reviews.text: My four year old was so excited to get this for her birthday! Added some reflective stickers to personalize it! Great balance bike! Love to foot rest option that most balance bikes don’t have.
customer_reviews.author: LindsayRDH

customer_reviews.title: but it is still useful and helping her with balance
customer_reviews.text: got this for my 6 year old to finish out this summer and then next summer my 3 year old will use it. Maybe a little small for the 6 year old (she's petite), but it is still useful and helping her with balance. Seat adjusts well, and will likely fit the 3 year old perfectly next year. Met all expectations!
customer_reviews.author: KLaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: The bike is good quality and is easy to adjust the seat, but is too heavy for my 2 year old girl to maneuver right now. She weighs about 26 lbs. for reference. Hoping she's still interested in it in a year!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy D

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old son for his birthday and he really likes it. We havent been able to use it much yet but so far he seems to be getting the hang of it around the house. Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: AMS80

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. Bought for an average height 4 year old and fits him perfect with room to grow. I like that the tires are not the air up type. Nothing worse than a flat tire when it's always "I want to ride my bike please".
customer_reviews.author: JANICE

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Very good value. Would have happily paid a bit more for a hand brake so the only thing left to master when graduating to a pedal bike is turning the pedals. Also wish it could accommodate a slightly taller kid.
customer_reviews.author: KC00

customer_reviews.title: Love these bikes
customer_reviews.text: Love these bikes! Ordered 2 for my 3 and 18month old and they both are able to ride easily (18month old took a little more practice but was able to figure it out and built up his balance quickly! Definitely recommend to all new young bike riders!
customer_reviews.author: Karli

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it. She rides this all the time
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves this bike. I highly recommend it. She rides this all the time. And she was coasting on it within the first month and at faster speeds then I was comfortable with. I think the transition to a regular bike without training wheels will be pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy F

product_meta.title: KaZAM v2e No Pedal Balance Bike
product_meta.description: No Pedals - No Problem! Say Goodbye to training wheels and skinned knees! Designed without pedals, the KaZAM Balance Bike allows riders to develop their balance before introducing pedaling, making the transition onto traditional bikes seamless. After all, it's the balance that's the hard part, pedaling is easy! Sit...Walk, Glide, Coast...Balance, KaZAM! (Limited assembly required, tools included)
feature_bullets: Metal Ball Bearing Headset, Top & Bottom for Non-Friction, Easy Steering
Adjustable Seat with Quick Release (Min: 14.0 inches - Max: 17.0 inches)
Adjustable Handlebar Set (Min: 18.75 inches - Max 20.75 inches)
Ergonomically Designed For Proper Feet Placement & Balance
Easy Step-in Patented Frame Design with Footrest
Maintenance and Puncture Free 12 inch EVA Tires
